description.S1: Conrad is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: He runs a barber shop in Edgewater.

blurb.B1: Conrad Sadik is located in the Barber Shop inside Edgewater.
blurb.B2: You can talk to him and find out he is quite happy with his position at Edgewater,
blurb.B3: but he is broke and cannot afford the gravesite fee.
blurb.B4: He will offer his apologies and acceptance to have his Medical Rights revoked as he will have to default on this payment.
blurb.B5: He reveals he had the plague and was deemed worthy of treatment,
blurb.B6: but since the barber shop is not profitable he has spent his savings to keep it afloat.
blurb.B7: Tell him to give Silas an "I owe you".
blurb.B8: He will need something to give as collateral.
blurb.B9: Go to the back room and inspect a ledger and you'll find a note from Phyllis mentioning a receptionist's suicide and asking Conrad to pull the teeth.
blurb.B10: You can find the Golden Teeth items at the Botanical Labs greenhouse and bring them back,
blurb.B11: then use Persuade (1) and tell him that you have them.
blurb.B12: You will then receive 360xp and complete this portion of the quest.
blurb.B13: Alternatively: You can kill him for his Gravesite Fee

description.S1: You finished collecting gravesite fees from the people of Edgewater.

blurb.B1: After gathering all the gravesite fees,
blurb.B2: return to Silas to receive a reward of 300 bits.
blurb.B3: With a Persuade 6 check, Silas will agree to upping the reward by 150 bits.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: What can I do for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I know about Eugene. Why not use his teeth as collateral for your gravesite fees?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You sound like you've had some training. I know a thing or two about medicine.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: You know about Eugene? How?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I found a note from Phyllis.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: None of your business.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Then you know Phyllis suggested selling off Eugene's gold teeth. I didn't approve of the idea then, and I don't approve of it now.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Eugene's golden teeth were a family heirloom, representing three generations of poor dental hygiene. He took them to his grave.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: They were probably worth a few bits.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: More than a few. Those teeth were his personal savings.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: I can't ask Silas to dig up a man's body and pry a few teeth loose from his jaw, just to pay my bills. Can I?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're going to have to.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't care. I'm just here to collect your dues.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes, I suppose I must.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Here you are. Gravesite papers, affixed with my signature, and an IOU.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Goodbye.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: You probably heard it from one of our local gossip-mongers.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh? Am I in the company of a fellow doctor?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Only if we use the term doctor loosely.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So you prepare corpses for burial. Pretty specific job description.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm guessing you were trained at a medical school.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am a Spacer's Choice certified surgeon! And if you must know, I can stitch a severed thumb with a fifty-eight percent chance of avoiding gangrene.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: You may think that, but the tidiness of my fellow worker is my responsibility. Alive or otherwise.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whether you're showing up to work or going to that great cannery in the sky, it's my job to make you look like a million bits.

dialog.speaker: ConradSadik (Male)
dialog.utterance: Experience was my teacher. Experience and 'So You Want To Be An Embalmer,' brochures one through five, courtesy of the Spacer's Choice Department of Career Development.
